intro: Heliophila maraisiana, commonly known as the marsh heliophila, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Hydrocharitaceae and is typically found in wetland environments such as marshes and along the edges of water bodies. The plant has slender, grass-like leaves that are often submerged or floating, and it produces small, white or pale yellow flowers. It is an aquatic or semi-aquatic species that thrives in still or slow-moving water. Heliophila maraisiana plays a role in stabilizing aquatic ecosystems and providing habitat for various aquatic organisms.
